newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines raises o/night borrowing to 12 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippines raises o/night borrowing to 12 pct.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank raised its overnight borrowing rate to 12.0 percent from 11.25 percent, traders said on Wednesday.
The overnight lending rate was unchanged at 13.0 percent.
Central Bank treasurer Sergio Edeza confirmed the rate adjustment, saying: "This is just a preemptive action in view of what has happened in Thailand. We don't want a spillover in the Philippines."
The Thailand baht was hit by speculative attacks on late Wednesday on economic uncertainties.
Edeza said the Central Bank would not stop raising its rates if speculation hits the Philippine peso.
The Central Bank also raised its five-day reverse repo rate to 12.0 percent from 11.0 percent.
At the same time, it lowered its one-month reverse repo rate to 10.5 percent from 10.5625 percent and two-month reverse repo rate to 10.5625 percent from 10.625 percent.
The six-month reverse repo was kept unchanged at 10.875 percent. -- MANILA NEWSROOM (63 2) 841-8938 Fax 817-6267
